page.title: 02ATTITUDES- PAST & PRESENT.
page.content: Attitudes take many forms; here we are concerned with village life&lifestyle. Hereabouts the villages were primarily concerned with coalmining; older resi- dents regret the passing of the close gregarious nature of those communities somewhat introverted/insular but from it finding security,& a sense of iden- tity within communal self suficiency. Heterogeneous incomers to these small communities require a more personal form of self sufficiency, yet we see that community spirit still exists; eg the proposal of some residents for a Sunday School in Binchester Community Centre, the fact that the Comm Centre exists; in providing play-parks & the organisation of jazz-bands or local carnivals. Nevertheless, incomers &the ubiquitous car, have reduced local insularity re friends, family, entertainment, etc.
